title: 105_hr1014
content: The "Brooke Amendment Restoration Act" allows public housing agencies to set rental contributions for assisted families at less than 30% of their incomes. This amendment modifies the United States Housing Act of 1937. The "Brooke Amendment Restoration Act" allows public housing agencies to set rental contributions for assisted families at less than 30% of their incomes. Section 8 Vouchers and Section 8 Certificates under the United States Housing Act of 1937 are amended to specify the minimum amount determined by the public housing agency for assistance payments. The contract specifies the rent amount for tenant-based and project-based assistance. Section 8 of the United States Housing Act of 1937 is amended to clarify payment details for manufactured homes. The United States Housing Act of 1937 is amended to specify payment details for various housing programs, including Section 8 homeownership and public housing management opportunities. Additionally, amendments are made to the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act regarding excessive rent burdens, public housing mixed-income new communities strategy demonstration, and supportive housing for elderly families. Amendments are made to Section 811(d) of the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act to specify tenant rent contributions and maximum allowable amounts. Amendments to the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act include specifying tenant rent contributions and maximum allowable amounts for grants for Community Residences for Persons With AIDS and the HOME Program. The Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act is amended to specify tenant rent contributions and maximum allowable amounts for grants. Amendments also include adjustments to Section 236 Rental Assistance under the National Housing Act. The Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act is amended to specify tenant rent contributions and maximum allowable amounts for grants, including adjustments to Section 236 Rental Assistance. Section 206(d)(6) is also amended to address tenant rent increases. The Urban-Rural Recovery Act of 1983 is amended to specify tenant rent payments. The Shelter Plus Care Program and Housing for Rural Homeless and Migrant Farm Workers are also adjusted to limit recipient payments. The Rural Housing Voucher Program is amended to address rent contributions. The Housing Act of 1949 is amended to specify minimum amounts for tenant rent payments. The amendments made by this Act do not authorize any increase in housing assistance provided by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, except for public housing.
